perturbation.original_text:
THIS ENDORSEMENT AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) by and between GENO AURIEMMA (“Auriemma”) and BERKSHIRE BANK, a 
Massachusetts savings bank with its principal place of business at 24 North Street, Pittsfield, MA 01210 (“Berkshire”)(Each or both of which shall 
hereinafter be referred to as the “PARTY” or “PARTIES,” respectively).
perturbation.changed_text:
THIS ENDORSEMENT AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) by and between GENO AURIEMMA (“Auriemma”) and BERKSHIRE BANK, a 
Massachusetts savings bank with its principal place of business at 24 North Street, Pittsfield, MA 01210 (“Berkshire”)(Each or both of which shall 
hereinafter be referred to as the “PARTY” or “Individual,” respectively).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'PARTIES' to 'Individual' creates ambiguity as to whether 'PARTY' always refers to multiple entities or can also refer to a single person. This could lead to disputes regarding obligations that apply to single vs. multiple entities.

perturbation.original_text:
a) “CONTRACT PERIOD” means that period of time commencing upon the full execution of this Agreement by both Parties and 
terminating on May 31, 2016 unless sooner terminated under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
a) “CONTRACT PERIOD” means that period of time commencing upon the full execution of this Agreement by both Participants and 
terminating on May 31, 2016 unless sooner terminated under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Parties' to 'Participants' introduces a new, undefined term. It's unclear whether 'Participants' refers to the same entities as 'Parties' or something else, creating confusion about who is bound by the contract terms.

perturbation.original_text:
13. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS.

If any provision(s) of this Agreement shall be determined to be void, ambiguous, or unenforceable, the same shall be stricken from this Agreement 
and in no way shall affect other provisions of, or the validity or enforceability of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
13. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS.

If any term(s) of this Agreement shall be determined to be void, ambiguous, or unenforceable, the same shall be stricken from this Agreement 
and in no way shall affect other provisions of, or the validity or enforceability of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'provision(s)' to 'term(s)' creates inconsistency. While seemingly similar, legal 'provisions' encompass broader aspects than individual 'terms'. This raises questions about the scope of severability; does invalidating a term invalidate the entire related provision?
